comment._content: Walter Winans was a famous breeder and exhibitor of driving horses. See these two 1910 New York Times articles: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9506E1DF1339E433A... query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=950CE7D81239E433A...

comment._content: Thanks for the information. We will add it to our source data and reload the description.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Walter W. Winans (April 5, 1852 – August 12, 1920) was an American marksman, sculptor, and painter who participated in the 1908 and 1912 Summer Olympics. He won two medals for shooting: a gold in 1908 and a silver in 1912. He also won a gold medal for his sculpture An American Trotter at Stockholm in 1912. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Winans
